title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.15 | 28-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Vidura, born in the womb of a Shudra woman, was forbidden even to be a party of royal heritage, along with his brothers Dhritarashtra and Pandu.
segments.summary: This segment explains the story of Vidura's birth as the son of a maidservant, his relationship to Dhritarashtra and Pandu, and his resulting lack of inheritance rights.

segments.key_quote: Anyone who is conversant in the transcendental knowledge or the science of Godhead, be he a Brahmana or a Shudra...he is a Brahman.
segments.summary: This segment addresses the question of how Vidura, born a Shudra, could instruct learned Kshatriyas, explaining that spiritual qualification and transcendental knowledge are more important than birth.

segments.key_quote: One who knows in truth that science of Krishna consciousness...he is qualified to occupy the post of a spiritual master, a spiritual preceptor, a guru, a qualified guru.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that knowledge of Krishna consciousness qualifies one to be a spiritual master, regardless of birth, and references Chanakya Pandit's similar views.

segments.key_quote: The second part of the answer is Vidura was not actually a Shudra. He was to play the part of a so-called Shudra.
segments.summary: This segment provides the second part of the answer, explaining that Vidura was actually the incarnation of Yamaraj, one of the twelve Mahajanas, and therefore an authority on Dharma.

segments.key_quote: Such a devotee is never a Shudra, or a Brahmana, or a householder, or a sannyasi. He is transcendental to all divisions of varna and ashrama.
segments.summary: This segment concludes by stating that Yamaraj took birth as Vidura to participate in Krishna Leela and that as a pure devotee, he is transcendental to all social divisions, making him qualified to preach to anyone.
